channel.title: noTrade Help
channel.description:
Okay here is my code: [code] public int untradable[] = { 6818}; // put all untradable itemz here bitchz XD - xero untradable("16003");[/code]
When I compile I get this: [code]client.java:969: invalid method declaration; return type required untradable("16003"); ^ client.java:969: illegal start of type untradable("16003"); ^ 2 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Any Help?
I also did addItem("16003"); and it didn't work.

item.title: noTrade Help
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Or like this:

	public boolean isUntradable(int item) {
		for(int i = 0; i < untradable.length; i++) {
			if(untradable[i] == item) {
				return true;
			}
		}
		return false;
	}

Read full topic

item.title: noTrade Help
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“Mercifies, post:1, topic:321675”]Okay here is my code:

public int untradable[] = { 6818}; // put all untradable itemz here bitchz XD - xero untradable("16003");

When I compile I get this:

client.java:969: invalid method declaration; return type required untradable("16003"); ^ client.java:969: illegal start of type untradable("16003"); ^ 2 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

Any Help?

I also did addItem(“16003”); and it didn’t work.[/quote]

You’re calling the array as if it’s a method…and you’re not calling the elements correctly. If you were to do:

untradable[0]

it would grab the first element in the array, which happens to be ‘6818’. If you wanted to use ‘16003’, then do:

public int untradable[] = { 6818, 16003 };
then grab that element like so:

untradable[1]

Read full topic

item.title: noTrade Help
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

16003 has to be inside the array.

public int untradable[] = { 6818, 16003}; // put all untradable itemz here bitchz XD - xero

Read full topic

item.title: noTrade Help

When I compile I get this:

client.java:969: invalid method declaration; return type required untradable("16003"); ^ client.java:969: illegal start of type untradable("16003"); ^ 2 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

Any Help?

I also did addItem(“16003”); and it didn’t work.
